p: A. conyzoides, A. vulgaris, and H. annuus essential oils expressed antimicrobial activities against both bacteria (MSSA and MRSA) and yeasts ( C. albicans, C. glabrata, and C. tropicalis). Our investigations witnessed anti-MRSA and anti- Candida effects of A. vulgaris essential oil. Those capacities could be attributed to a large amount of mono- and sesquiterpenes compounds such as sabinene, Î²-thujone, chrysanthenone, camphor, and borneol in A. vulgaris oil [ 43].
